After snagging a great deal ($25 for $50 worth of food and alcohol) from Travelzoo we decided to check out Zen for dinner.  They run specials nearly every day of the week. On Wednesdays they have live music and half off sangria ($3) so those were nice little added perks. The musician was really good without being disruptive, and the sangria wasn't overly sweet!   After reading a recommendation from Yelp we tried the blue-cheese calamari. They aren't overly blue-cheesy, and while being decent I would try the tuna appetizer next time.   For my entree I went with two specialty rolls. I ordered the Red Dragon and the Fresh Cucumber rolls. I always ask for whole pieces of tuna rather than chopped (a texture thing), and thankfully they were able to accomodate no problem. I absolutely loved the Red Dragon roll and would get that again next time.   My husband had Pad Thai, my sister-in-law had Chicken Hibachi, and my brother in law had Sushi as well. Everyone was happy with their meals.   The desserts looked awesome but we were way too stuffed to eat anything else..next time!  Our server (I cannot recall his name off-hand, Dave?), was extremely nice and was super patient when half of our party was running a little late. He made great suggestions and was just overall completely on-the-ball.   I will definitely return!

We used to do team events here a lot. One time, there was a lobster and shrimp special that I absolutely loved! Alas, I was unable to have the chef recreate the dish the few other times I came after.   Casual dining, enjoyable Asian food. We almost always blow our budget by having tons of patron ;p

Me and my boyfriend went here for dinner last night because I had a Chinese food craving and thought it would be good to try something new. Honestly, I wasn't impressed at all. Forget hitting the spot, the food here didn't even get anywhere near the spot. Firstly, the place is pretty small and has a rather weird layout. We were seated at a table near the bar and man, did the sound of the bartender shaking up drinks get annoying! It was so loud that I had trouble hearing my boyfriend a couple times. No sooner were we seated than the waitress asked us if we wanted to start off with any appetizers. I mean, at least give us a chance to look at the menu! Other than that, she was very attentive and courteous so I'll give them points for service.  We ordered the steamed pork pot stickers, which were pretty decent. For entrees, I ordered the Kung Pao chicken and my boyfriend had the Mongolian Crispy Fried Noodles. The Kung Pao chicken was disgusting. Firstly, it was not spicy at all, even though it's marked as spicy on their menu. The chicken wasn't marinated and tasted like boiled chicken covered with sauce. The Mongolian Crispy Fried Noodles were much better, although nothing really worth writing home about. I'm never going back. I'd much rather eat at places that focus one thing and master it rather than being a Jack of all trades and trying their hand at everything from Chinese and Thai to Spanish and Tapas.

This was my second visit here it was my friends birthday an she is vegan an they fix food to her needs.  Ordered edamame to hold me until everyone ordered yum.  My friend ordered the mushrooms of which they normally use butter but used olive oil for her.  I ordered the Shrimp fettuccini with tomato sauce. The shrimp huge prawns an so much food , shrimp was cooked perfectly.   I cant wait to go back the staff was great you have so many different choices a place you dont wanna skip.

Don't let the name fool you.  Yes there's sushi and Asian food but they are not "fused" together with the Spanish fare and tapas.  Surprisingly, they have distinct dishes from Japanese, Vietnamese, Thai, all the way to Spanish specialties.  Once we entered during the early bird dinner time, we were quickly greeted and easily seated.  The decor was nice and probably would have been more romantic atmosphere if the sun wasn't shining outside.  However they do have an outdoor patio that I'll have to try next time.  Onto the food (no tapas for our appetite): my wife and I tried the Churrasco de Cerdo, Sesame crusted ahi tuna, a Miro roll, and the tres leches cake for dessert.  Everything was delicious!  A little pricey but a social deal of $25 for 50 allowed us the courage to try the pricier dishes.  The pork was flattened but nicely seasoned with rice and beans. Ask for their hot sauce to add even more flavors. And no, I'm not referring to Texas Pete or Tabasco.  The ahi tuna was a larger portion than the norm, so at $18 I was content.  As for the desserts, they house make the tres leches cake while the others are sourced from a bakery.  So I'd suggest their tres leche cake, light and tasty and not too rich.  They have daily drink specials, mostly discounted wines by the glass or half price bottles.  The surrounding Dilworth location can get cramped.  Fortunately there is a parking lot accessible beside the Harris Teeter shopping plaza behind the Dilworth Coffee.
I'm very sad to say that they stopped serving sushi about 6 months ago....that is such a shame because it was one of my favorite sushi spots...I am really gonna miss the "sole" roll

While the idea of Spanish and Asian fusion doesn't sound appealing, Zen Fusion is simply outstanding at creating both cuisines.   Everyone in my party really enjoyed their food. Everything from their noodle stir fries to their paella was quite delicious! I was very impressed with the price point as well - you don't have to wait for a special occasion to get high quality cuisine here.  I had such a difficult time selecting off the menu, but I'm sure I will be back to sample more Spanish dishes, sushi, and tapas!
Everything we ordered was delicious. Probably best basil chicken and spring rolls I ever had in charlotte area

I have been here several times now and while the food has been consistently good, the service has not. I've tried a variety of food such as the salmon, hibachi shrimp, and mixed vegetables and all have been good. However, every time I've eaten in the actual restaurant, the service has been subpar. I have usually been greeted nicely at the door but after that it just goes downhill with individual servers. I don't think any of the servers are actually rude, I just think they get busy. I will likely continue to eat here but it will probably be on a takeout only basis.

We eat at a different restaurant in the Charlotte area every Saturday with friends. But on Friday nights, we keep going back to Zen Asian Fusion. The food, atmosphere and service are exceptional. The Tre Ci Luce Cake is my favorite desert.

Wow! How did I not find out about this place sooner. I came here last night with my boss we had a couple small dishes including the Tuna Nachos (so yummy) and Blue Cheese Calamari, which is to dieeeeee for.  We also go the Pad Thai, which I can't say was great, but it wasn't bad.  The two earlier dishes though, were so delicious!  We also got their sangria which was on special and that was pretty good in addition. There was indoor seating as well as it appeared to be a half covered outdoor patio, although we didn't go out there.  I will definitely be returning and it wont be too long before I do! :)

I still don't get the concept. I usually am about picking one thing and doing it well. We leaned toward the Asian dishes as they looked more appealing. Got the firecracker roll and I thought it was okay, but too reliant on sauce for taste- I actually like the taste of raw fish and this was American ized a bit too much for my tastes.  The mussels were okay. In a spicy ' ish tomato based sauce. Again, I wanted to taste the mussels themselves more. But, they were good sized and cooked well. They were served with soft rolls. I think something along the line of a crisp or crunchy bread would have been a better texture combo.  However I can honestly say I Loved the sashimi carpaccio. We got tuna, and it was delicious. Would strongly recommend. Our server Hiram was efficient but not intrusive. Parking was a breeze even at 730 on Friday.  I'll be back.
Delicious food, wonderful service and a great price.  I would recommend this to anyone who likes Asian and Spanish food.  I'm definitely coming back!

Today's meal was really gross but I was at a work lunch so had to choke it down. I am really not sure what was going on with the chicken...the texture was gooey and not like any chicken I have ever tasted. The service was also very slow and it was not that crowded. Very disappointing.

Stopped in for a quick bite before the Katt Williams's comedy show. Ordered the Thai Basil Veggie stir fry. Nice atmosphere, server was quick and attentive. The food was good, fresh and flavorful. Good spot to try if your new to Charlotte like me and need to find your go to spots! Looks like people enjoyed the wine and bar as well.

I've been a customer for a long time at Zen for several reasons their quality of food, their excellent service and cozy atmosphere. Zen is located in one of Charlotte's nicest neighborhood so if you're looking for cheap Asian food- this isn't the place to go to. if you're looking for fresh ingredients and great service as an added bonus to make your dining experience more enjoyable go to Zen. It's worth it!  Try the Zen ginger martini.

We went to Zen today for lunch. It is an interesting concept because it menu provides an option of Asian inspired dishes as well as Spanish inspired dishes. The table went for Asian, except for one friend, who went with a Spanish inspired salad.  We had a group of 7 and needed to be seated quickly because we have exactly 1 hour for lunch. I called ahead to make a reservation which was a really easy process and our table was ready for us when we arrived.  Our server was friendly and attentive. My water glass was always full which was a plus!  I enjoyed my lunch (Kung Pow Chicken) but it was not the best I've ever had. It said on the menu it was supposed to be spicy, but I had to ask for a side of chili oil and siracha to make it spicy to my taste (it was rather mild). It was a large portion, so I will have leftovers for dinner! The amount of veggies was great. I am only giving two stars because while the service was good and the food was fine, I have had much better Chinese food and I prefer other Asian places in Charlotte (SoHo Bistro, KO Sushi). And minus one start because no sushi menu for lunch!  Solid-ish place, good service, ok food. I was content with my meal. I would go back, maybe at dinner so I could try the sushi. I am still confused by the Asian/Spanish theme.

This place is pretty good. I enjoy the lo mein noodles.  They are always fresh and delish. The service is hit or miss.  The environment is very nice, hip, cool.  Speaking of cool, take a sweater because it's always chilly! Prices are a bit high.

Given other reviews I was not expecting much but was pleasantly surprised. I had the sesame crusted ahi tuna which was excellent. Companions had the zarzuela and Singapore noodles which they both enjoyed (plates left clean!). Service was attentive and we all enjoyed the sangria special and live music (Wednesdays only). Only negative was the Tres leches cake- I was really looking forward to this as it's made in house but found the cake to be dry when it should have been moist and soaked in the condensed milk. Others found it too sweet overall.   In any case, I would come here again.

Went to Zen Asian Fusion for Valentine's Day with a reservation. Arrived early, sat at the bar and had a glass of sangria and blue cheese calamari. Both were delicious and the sangria was a great price ($6). Once we sat our table, we had the potstickers (lovely) and the Mongolian stir fry but subbed the crispy noodles. Everything was very tasty!

We really enjoyed our visit to Zen. The service was friendly and very helpful. The atmosphere was nice, as well. We had a Zen Mojito and Zen 88, both were very good.  For appetizers we had the empanadas and the gazpacho. Also, I believe that the gazpacho has cream in it. Both were fair and both needed a kick of flavor, maybe some jalapenos.  For our entrees we ordered the Green Curry with Chicken and the Paella Valenciana. The Green Curry was exceptional. It was just the right amount of spice and the chicken was sliced thinly and cooked perfectly. It was a large portion.  The Paella Valenciana was authentic with shrimp, mussels, clams, calamari, and fish. The tomato sauce was good. While, traditional Paella isn't necessarily spicy it would have been nice if it would have had a bit of spice to it. I had to add pepper. But still it was overall very good. All of the seafood was very well cooked. The portion wasn't huge but it was enough after having a drink and an appetizer.  For dessert we shared the pineapple upside down cake and WOW! It was definitely the highlight of the meal! The cake was very moist and it had a strip of cheesecake in the middle! Very tasty!  Overall, our experience was very nice and we would definitely go back again!

My favorite restaurant in Charlotte. Friendly service; they seem to know everybody by name, and treat me like a regular -- or even their only -- customer, even though I only make it there every few months. Fantastic value. Great, intimate atmosphere. I have never been disappointed in any dish, and I have tried many of them over the years. Don't miss the tres leches cake!  Genuine hospitality and kindness goes a long way, and that's what you get at Zen, along with delicious food.
Love Zen! The food, staff and people that always support are fantastic.... if you haven't been to Zen yet- please put on your list!
The food is fantastic and the service is spectacular! The calamari is soooooo good and the tres leches is Devine. The coconut cake is out of this world

I'm a huge fan of Asian Fusion cuisine but sadly, my experience at Zen was less than stellar.  A girlfriend and I met there at noon on a random Wednesday for lunch.  She ordered Sesame Chicken and I ordered Hibachi Chicken.  We both had salads (which were very watery)--actually, she didn't order a salad but they mistakenly brought one out for her.  After waiting over 45 minutes for our food, we asked the waiter how much longer we should expect to wait (after all, we both had post-lunch clients that would be waiting!).  Our food eventually came out and it was delicious!  I was not disappointed in either of our entrees but was rather annoyed at the amount of time it took to get it.  50% of our bill was removed for our inconvenience.  While that was a nice gesture, I'm not sure I'll make plans to go back anytime soon.  Customer service, especially on the first visit, is critical...sadly, Zen fell short.

We waited an hour for a table, so my expectations were high (long wait should equal excellent food, right?). The food was mediocre, and that is me being generous with the rating. I ordered the Thai Green Curry....meh. There was very little gravy; the veg was under cooked; portion of rice didnt match the portion of veg. Lychee martini had canned lychee in the cocktail...I prefer fresh.

First time visit and the food was amazing. We got black bean soup and lettuce wraps to start, both excellent. I had the chimi pork with black beans and plantains which was amazing and BF got the Chicken Pad Thai which was the BEST Ive tried in Charlotte. For dessert tres leches which was served on a cold plate with cold forks... this place definately pays attention to detail. Very warm cozy and friends, service was great... seemed like a place where everybody knew everybody and it they had a lot of regulars

I love going to Zen, the owners and staff just make you feel very welcome. It's no surprise then that place has many regulars. I will be one. We did a tapas style dinner, our waiter, David, was genuinely helpful.
Service is fantastic, and the food is very good! Highly recommend the pot stickers, empanadas, and spicy tuna  nachos!

It was decent. I loved my dish but some of my friends didn't like theirs.   I had the sesame crusted ahi tuna and it was really good. The tuna was just right and the sauce was fantastic. However, I tried some kind of spanish Chicken dish and the chicken was super dry. They had to return it and order something else. They got the seabass instead cooked with a light ginger soy sauce. It was cooked just right and the taste was really good. I just think everything is a bit overpriced for the quality of food.   I do have to say I like the atmosphere of the restaurant. It's very intimate and classy, a good place for a date night.   So if you decide to go here, my advice is to stay away from the chicken and order seafood!

I have fallen in love with this cute spot in the heart of Dilworth.   Today was my second time visiting. You're greeted very warmly at the door. We sat in a high-back booth that provided ample privacy in this intimate space.   Today, I tried the soup over the salad. I'm not a big tofu fan, but the tiny chunks in the soup were actually a nice added touch with the greens. I'm a creature of habit and will get hibachi shrimp whenever and wherever I can. Theirs will not disappoint you. The lunch portion is significantly smaller than the dinner portion but the price reduction reflects it. Eight or so rather large shrimp come with the meal. I LOVE their fried rice so I doubled that in lieu of vegetables. Drowned in shrimp sauce, the hibachi shrimp and rice hit the spot!  I will definitely go back and eat inside for dinner; I did dinner carry out last week. They serve wine and spirits and have outdoor seating which would make for a lovely outing.

Zen is definitely more then Asian Fusian, offering Asian, Spanish and even sushi.  Zen is located in a small shopping center off of East Blvd and could be the hidden gem only known to locals in the area.  I have ordered pick up and enjoyed everything and this past visit I was craving sushi and decided to take a seat at the bar and enjoy some good food. Upon arrival I was surprised to see the place was packed on a weeknight, with a 20 minute wait. The host was extremely friendly and that service only continued at the bar. I ordered a martini, half price the night I was there and started with the miso soup and pork dumplings, fried. The soup was good, but the dumplings could have been some of the best I have ever had.  Sometimes dumplings can lack filling and flavor, these did not. They were stuffed with an amazing pork mixture that was flavorful and only better once dipped in their ponzu sauce.  After enjoy the appetizers I decided on one roll, the Red Dragon. Let me tell you this is an enormous roll, and delicious.  Shrimp tempura, cream cheese and cucumber topped with spicy tuna.  Even though I loved it I could not finish it, I guess I enjoyed the dumplings too much. However, I definitely look forward to my next visit and cannot wait to try more items off this spectacular menu.

Interesting blend of Asian and Spanish Tapas. Very attentive service and quick on a weekday lunch at least. Great Thai soup and nicely cooked fish entrees. I do wish they offered sushi at lunch, presentation for entrees was a bit to be desired but overall I'd come again.

I like their lunch menu.  I also like the fact that they have green tea.  I had red curry, beef with jasmine rice previously.  Their pork egg rolls are also very unique. Most similar restaurants offer veggie/shrimp/spring rolls and do not put much meat into their rolls.  Zen Asian Fusion offers good customer services.  Their servers nonetheless need to smile more but I appreciate their regular check ups on their customers.  I also enjoyed the lighting and the overall peaceful ambience.  I will return to experience other of their dishes and report back. :)

Sometimes you just want a happy medium. And that's okay.  For dinner, the Mr. wanted sushi, and I'm easy to please, so I went with the veggie green curry. Top that off with tofu summer rolls and a miso soup, our takeout order was complete. We went to pick it up, and it was ready at the appointed time.  As for the curry, it was just fine. Nothing outstanding, full of vegetables and served with brown rice. I enjoyed the flavor, but kept encountering strings of some unidentifiable green stalk in my bowl. Not the most appetizing discovery.  Summer rolls were not the best. But they did in a pinch. The peanut sauce they were served with didn't deliver anything spectacular.  The Mr. reported that the sushi was actually pretty terrible, and sitting next to him, it smelled pretty terrible, too.  Not sure about the dine-in experience, but hopefully it's better than the takeout situation.

SO GOOD! My friend and I happened to decide to come here on a Saturday for dinner during happy hour (5-6:30 on Friday and Saturday). We each ordered an appetizer and a sushi roll to share (4 plates total) and our bill combined was $27. What?! A total steal! They refilled our waters every time we took a couple of sips, the waitress was very sweet, and the owner checked up on all the tables to make sure everyone was happy.  We ordered: - steamed potstickers (I think there were 6 of them for $4, great!) - muscles (I don't remember the actual name of the tapas, but the sauce was amazing!!) - firecracker roll (my least fave out of the four but still good) - Bruce Lee roll - Get it, you'll love it!

Really nice atmosphere and good food.  I have sat down at the bar for some sushi and wine, as well as enjoyed dinner in the dining area.  All of the food (I only had Asian food) was high quality, and the service was good.  There was nothing that really stood out about this place, though, that makes me want to come back consistently.  The place is not extremely pricey, but it isn't cheap.  I think it's the overall value that made me feel unexcited about this restaurant that was a decent place.
Mediocre Americanized Asian food. Tried bunch of dishes. None of them was good. Great ambiance, but that's about it. At least not for me...

Have been there several times, always enjoy the food.  Everyone I come in contact with has been very nice and accommodating.  I tried the shasimi last night, tuna and salmon. Interesting twist with the jalapeno.  My friend tried the cream sauce, it was ok.

A delightful surprise as we were forced to select a different restaurant from another having a long wait. Asian was not even on my radar, but we decided to give it a try. Everything was amazing! Our server was quite attentive and informative ,very personable. My husband had a curried vegetable dish with added chicken while I chose the steak hibachi dish. Atmosphere was dim lit modern setting and the floor plan for setting flows quite well.  I will definitely stop in again for dinner!

First and foremost, if you wish to visit this location for lunch be sure to have a reservation and arrive a little earlier than 11:30am. The parking lot was busy and little hectic when I first arrived. I went for a team outing with my co-workers and the ambiance is relaxed and inviting. While it may initially appear to be pricey, the lunch menu items were no more than $13 and the Sushi menu was around the same price point. So, even if you're just trying to impress someone for lunch, you will not break the bank (always a win in my book)!   Once we were seated, our server was attentive and very polite (unfortunately I didn't catch his name). We received our drinks and food within a reasonable time, so there's no complaint regarding the service. And if you ordered water, then you can expect a refill every two minutes (lol). I may be exaggerating a bit, but for all 5 water refills at my table, I received only 2 refills of tea. My co-workers and I just laughed it off but it may be more helpful if customers were at least asked if they would like a refill or not.   Once we received our food, I was super excited because the Asain Pork Pot Stickers were amazing! However, my food was just.... ok! It wasn't bad but it also wasn't phenomenal! The rice was really good, but the meat and veggies could've used more sauce/spices.   I will definitely try them another time and give their sushi menu a chance.

I'm so glad I decided to stop in for a last minute dinner. Many of the seats were occupied, but my friend and I were able to be seated with no wait. Dinner consisted of fried potstickers, the Bruce Lee roll, the Zen roll, and paella Valencia. I've had the paella at the sister restaurant, Miro- so I knew what to expect. Everything else was a first. The sushi rolls were delicious and the dumplings and paella were on point. I will return here, especially with Duck Donuts only a few storefronts away- this could be trouble!
